alert.note: Alert for Duplin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Lenoir and northwestern Duplin Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 213 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Dunn to 6 miles west of Clinton. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Warsaw, Mount Olive, Bowdens, Beautancus, Faison and Calypso. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
